website_summaries.verdict: Looking for an inexpensive pair of earphones to power your daily commute? RHA has you covered with the surprisingly good-sounding $20 MA150.
cons: No in-line mic or phone controls
Slight harshness in the upper midrange

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: These sound great with a good eq; i use viper4android set to flat/common earphone v2/tube simulator/natural bass/viper clarity and get loud but tight bass, clear mids, and bright highs. They also do a solid job of blocking out sound. On the down side, you have to wrap the cords around your ears. They are made of a tacky rubber that transmits a ton of rubbing and thumping if you don't. Side note, only the supplied tips work. aftermarket's fit but don't recess over the horn and make the buds stick out of your ears. At least they give you multiple sizes. Overall, these are better sounding than most of the $40-60 buds I've been buying.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent earphones, especially for the price, and deliver clear sound. I find them a bit lacking in bass but otherwise they're good. UPDATE 08-06-13: I had to downgrade my original rating of four stars and "Nice Quality" to three stars and "good quality." I bought two of these headsets on March 16, 2013 and just four months after my husband started using one of them, it's broken. The plug or the wires, not sure which, no longer deliver sound properly. I expected a longer lifespan. There is a twelve-month warranty but I'm not sure if it covers this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian SB

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box and noisy cords
customer_reviews.text: I don't get all the reviews for these headphones. The pair I got seemed defective right out of the box -- could hear music very clearly but vocals for all the songs I played were so soft as to be inaudible. I tried 3 different iPods which all worked fine with other headphones. I jiggled the plug a little bit and would sometimes get the vocals to be normal in audibility but just for a second or so before fading away. Also, there was tons of noise from the cord touching anything -- which was extremely loud in the seconds between songs -- how come no one else mentioned this? Sending them back as defective.
customer_reviews.author: L.F.

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding with very good noise isolation for the price
customer_reviews.text: I initially made a complaint because they didn't arrive on time and blamed RHA. Post office was to blame. So, for the money they are the best that I have used. I don't spend more than $20 for any earbuds since I use them almost exclusively for exercise and they never seem to last more than a year. So far these have been great. Nice light cables, great fit. Only thing I don't like is the 1/8 plug is angled and not straight. I would prefer a straight mini jack as it's more versatile IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Gene A. Rynkewicz

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, bad quality
customer_reviews.text: In short, these are great sounding buds, and super cheap. It's a great bargain, BUT.... I went through THREE PAIRS. One side would always short out. But great customer service! They shipped me new buds when the old ones broke, but a pair a month is crazy. You should never have to actually use the warranty. If you get a pair that works, then great. Because the sound is very good. But I can't get past how flimsy they were. I had to get different headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: High end sound at budget price
customer_reviews.text: These sounds great. I mean really, really good. Easily as good as my friend's Beats by Dre ear buds and these cost a fraction of his. My only complaint is the cord rubbing / hitting your shirt while jogging transfers a ton of noise to you. You can cut it way down by clipping the cord to your shirt. It would be nice to have a clip included. Other wise no complains. Solid buds at an unbelievable price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Payer

customer_reviews.title: These headphones sound amazing first off
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound amazing first off. I can honestly say they almost sound like my sisters in ear beats. However I have bought 2 pairs of these headphones and they always go out within 2-5 months. I would suggest getting a little higher quality of the RHA brand and seeing if they will hold up better. But for the price i would say these are good headphones. Also i work out with these 4-6 times a week so maybe the sweat had something to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Colton Roy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little ear buds! The quality of these are pretty amazing for $13. They sound crisp, highs come in clear and the lows resonate when correctly worn. These are light, but the ear buds have a sturdy construction. Comes with three different tips, appropriate length cord, the Y split slider doesn't catch up. The ONLY reason that I would go up a level in terms of price to the RHA M350's would be that the 350's have a corded cable and aluminum ear bud body instead of molded plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Larson

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time a charm
customer_reviews.text: The first pair that came had the problem out of the box that a few others have mentioned with the connection not being secure between cable and jack; it worked fine for sound on one side, but only with wiggling the wire in the other. However, the manufacturer replaced the ear buds quickly and easily with a new set--excellent customer service--and the sound from the new pair is outstanding. Comfortable in the ears, too. A great value.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Rosebrook

customer_reviews.title: Good in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my girlfriend and she loves them. I personally don't like this kind of ear bud that you have to force into your ear, but most people don't mind them. She tells me they sound fantastic and are exactly what she wanted. Based on this, I would recommend them to those who prefer this kind of ear bud.
customer_reviews.author: John Carter

customer_reviews.title: JUNKS
customer_reviews.text: Read it's review on an article from Yahoo, so I ordered & regretted that I bought it, Took it on vacation to Cancun & missed all the headset I ever owned on the way there. The $9.98 JVC earphone from Fry's sounds way better. The original headset car with my iPhone sounds way better. I left it in the hotel for the cleaning lady. I'm sure she would be cursing at me for leaving it.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin

customer_reviews.title: Sound great, but don't expect these ear buds to last more than a couple months with lite use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm having the same experience as many other people: These earbuds sound great and fit well, but they seem to have a serious defect at the plug that causes them to fail after a couple months of lite-to-normal use. When my first pair of these ear buds broke, I gave them the benefit of the doubt decided to give them a second chance. Then yesterday right earbud spontaneously stopped working for no apparent reason. After two dead pairs, I see that I should have spent more on a different product. Save your money and spend more on a better pair of earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Bad for runners.
customer_reviews.text: Whoever said these are good for runners must not run very often. The earbuds are extremely uncomfortable. I tried all of the different sizes but all of them felt like they were falling out the entire time I was running. I had to constantly fuss with them during my workout, which is not enjoyable at all. I missed the cutoff to return these--otherwise I definitely would have sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: lymanized

customer_reviews.title: Great for people with small ears
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble finding earbuds small enough to stay in my ears and found these RHA earbuds through a Google search. They fit great and stay put in my tiny ears. I had been using Yurbuds women's earbuds but found that the silicone piece that fits over the earbuds kept coming off and getting lost plus the sound quality was crappy. Problems all solved by the RHA earbuds! The squishy piece that goes in your ear is very secure and the sound quality is great! I wore them in a half-marathon this weekend and they stayed put and performed great. I'm ordering a second pair for my husband who also has small ears.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Keats

customer_reviews.title: solid, cheap earbuds
customer_reviews.text: these earbuds have worked well for me. they seem to drown out a significant amount of background noise. the sound is very full and rich, they hold bass very well. i believe these were around $20, so a great value. these buds stick in my ears very well and would seem to be great buds to go running with, although i have not taken them for a run yet. i will try this and be back to edit my review!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Joseph Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, bad durability.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good for very reasonably priced headphones. Unfortunately they don't seem to be very durable. When the sound started going out on mine due to frayed/broken wires (after a few weeks of use) I chalked it up to how rough I can be on headphones while using them at work. However it wasn't more than a couple of weeks later that a friend with another pair from the same order had his also go out. These were only sparingly being used at home and seen no rough treatment. Unless you plan to be exceedingly careful with them, I wouldn't recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: SJLN

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just like all the other reviews, this is a great product for how inexpensive it is! I got it for a friend as a gift because she travels a lot on planes and wanted good earphones for it. I couldn't afford actual noise-canceling ones, but she seems very pleased with these ones saying that she could clearly hear her music on the plane (although she could still hear the sounds of the plane). She was also very pleased with the eco-friendly packaging and that it was small enough to keep around the house to store them in.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa

customer_reviews.title: I might like them if they worked.
customer_reviews.text: Imagine my disappointment: I was very excited about the relative price for these headphones, but there seems to be an issue with the 3.5mm plug. The headphones only work, sporadically, when the connection is jiggled or the plug is inserted halfway. From what little I could hear the ear-pieces might be able to produce decent sound and the seal from the inserts is pretty good. I'm not sure I'll be buying these cheap headphones a second time, so here's to hoping the 12mo covers crappy manufacturing. Waiting for response from seller. Will update on service/replacement quality when I hear back
customer_reviews.author: iRey

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pair of wired ear buds for general use (non exercise or physical activity). At the current cost, I would highly recommend these. The sound is clear and deep, and they fit comfortably in my ears (and included replacement rubber inserts). One tip, depending on your device, cut the volume lower than you normally use (my ipod tends to sit around 3/4 for volume, and with these earbuds, I had to drop it below 1/2). I'd highly recommend these to anybody looking for decent earbuds on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: chad klumpp

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I went out on a limb to see if they were worth the "deal". They weren't. The sound quality is fuzzy and they just don't stand up to even Apple's earbuds that come with the iPhones etc.....I wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tobes!

customer_reviews.title: They stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I use these for listening to podcasts on my dog walk. They work really well and stay in my ears while I am bouncing along. Very clear sound and sit very well in my ears. I have Dr Dre which fall out my ears with any kind of movement and cost 5 x the price!
customer_reviews.author: Bigz

customer_reviews.title: Headphones sounded great, came in nearly zero-waste packaging
customer_reviews.text: Headphones sounded great, came in nearly zero-waste packaging, and after my first pair shorted out after a few months, RHA immediately sent me a replacement pair. Unfortunately, that pair also shorted out (in the bend after the actual jack that so many earbuds seem to have problems with) a few months after getting them and I decided to try a different brand. I tried to be careful with the jack second time around, but it seems these headphones aren't built to last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Melton

customer_reviews.title: Nice earbuds for decent price
customer_reviews.text: They sound fine and work good. The jack is sized appropriately to work with most phone or ipad cases. It works great and sounds nice compared to most headphones that I have used. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Owen S.

customer_reviews.title: Meh...not pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these during mid February and within the first week (and I'm not talking from maintenance negligence, people) one of the ear buds went out. Today, not even 2 full months into the warranty, the ear buds on the second pair went out. The only reason I bought them was because of the 12 month warranty guarantee. Without that? Nope. I would have moved on to a sturdier set of headphones. The sound quality was pretty good though. No complaints there.
customer_reviews.author: Elements03

customer_reviews.title: The Best for the Money
customer_reviews.text: These ear buds are an example of getting a great product for a very fair price. The sound quality is excellent, they are rugged, and the price is about 1/3 of what I would expect to pay for a product of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lesyk

customer_reviews.title: Terrible headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones had good reviews and were supposedly good quality for a low price but I thought the quality was terrible. Very bassy and boomy. Also, the cable gauge is very thin which makes it tangle easy when not in use and probably means it won't last as long. These headphones can't touch my Sony headphones which were only slightly more $.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sechrest

customer_reviews.title: i'm in a whole new world.
customer_reviews.text: THE BASS IS GREAT. I go running with these all the time and the quality is incredible for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys ko

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and actually stayed in my ears better than ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and actually stayed in my ears better than expected, even while working out. I will definitely purchase this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Noisy chord
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I would recommend spending more for a pair that doesn't make noise every time the chord is tapped or bumped. If you're planning on using these for anything active, I wouldn't.
customer_reviews.author: andy coppinger

customer_reviews.title: GREAT sound.. great fit.. however..
customer_reviews.text: I liked these a lot, however after just a couple of months one of the earbuds quit working. A warranty is offered and I will follow up but I was hoping for pair that wouldn't have these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Travelin Val

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my Android phone Not so well on IPhone
customer_reviews.text: It works great in my Android phone, but my daughters IPhone doesn't work so well. we needed to wiggle the cable to get good connection with her phone. She doesn't have the same problem with other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: JIm Moos

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for a couple weeks of running before the ...
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted for a couple weeks of running before the wires broke
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Earphones
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two sets of headphones...one for my husband as well, so that we can use out iPads and listen to audio without disturbing each other. Really like them. Thanks for the sale.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M. Cando

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy review
customer_reviews.text: Quick Review: These are great headphones. Good bass response, decent midrange and not over the top high end. Surprisingly balanced for so little money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Seals

customer_reviews.title: Great ear buds
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality super comfortable to wear. Would highly recommend them to anyone. I plan on buying another set for when these die as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: One side stopped working in less than 6 months and i don't think it was due to rough handling.
customer_reviews.author: hg088

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price, but NOT for exercising!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones seemed to be okay in quality, but DO NOT exercise with them if they are going to get sweaty! One of my earbuds started cutting out after the 4th workout session.
customer_reviews.author: K Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Best $12 you'll spend earbuds. Not the most amazing sound I've ever heard, but absolutely worth more than the price.
customer_reviews.author: HawaiiR

customer_reviews.title: Not What I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I had read some good reviews on these earbusds, but I was disappointed. It has a very tinny sound, and one earpiece is intermittent.
customer_reviews.author: gingertech

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: These sound great and they do block a lot of outside sound as well. For the price they are a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Expectations met as described for this product. Even though not noise canceling, it did the job and was easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Annie T.

customer_reviews.title: its a $20 headphones expectations needs to be set.
customer_reviews.text: and sounds like it. i didn't expect anything spectacular, its just as good as those apple headphones. My only qualm is the headphone jack seems a bit too small for most inputs, and therefore barely holds, any shifting/movement would disconnect it.
customer_reviews.author: sheik khan

customer_reviews.title: For the price they are great.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for running and they never fall out. Noise canceling ability is good, and sound quality is excellent for the price. The Left Right designation will be difficult for people with poor eye sight but just put a piece of tape on one so you know.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Hall

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOUND
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY GOT THE RIGHT PAIR. I HAD BOUGHT 2 OTHER EAR HEADPHONES AND GAVE ONE TO MY HUSBAND AND THE OTHER TO MY GRANDDAUGHTER. THEY ARE SO COMFORTABLE AND THE SOUND IS AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.author: KATHY MIROLLA

customer_reviews.title: great sound
customer_reviews.text: comfortable, comes with an extra set of replacement posts, cord is plenty long, decent sound, great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: great earphones
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are perfect for listening to the CDs or my Kindle. They reproduce sound exactly as the overview suggested
customer_reviews.author: MsJazz

customer_reviews.title: good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but the bass could be a little more pronounced. Overall not a bad set of ear buds for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kenporter

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound quality compared to past earbuds. The only problem I had was the fit. I couldn't keep them in for good on the treadmill. Overall, satisfied though.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fiala

customer_reviews.title: great sound. sound is just as good at any ...
customer_reviews.text: simple. great sound. sound is just as good at any $100 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Poppabear

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised; good little headphones. Not as phenomenal as their big brother that costs a LOT more, but these do a great job -- like them for my small ears, too.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for price
customer_reviews.text: We had been looking for headphone that where good price and worked well. My husband really liked them because they are very sound proof once you wear them. I use them for the gym and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: lucia davila

customer_reviews.title: wire wearing out at connection
customer_reviews.text: wire at connector to iphone is shorting out after a few months and 10 3 mile runs. Disappointing, the sound and comfort are good. Steve
customer_reviews.author: Chipmaker

customer_reviews.title: Good product! Met my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound. Better than the headphones that came with my phone. Not as comfortable as others but they are water proof and sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Mora

customer_reviews.title: Clear highs, good lows
customer_reviews.text: and flat enough to use in bed at night ! Only negative is the skinny wires.A good buy at this price
customer_reviews.author: patman

customer_reviews.title: headphone jack broke after 2 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: I had these head phones for 2 days and the connection with my iphone or computer starting going on the fritz. You have to press on the headphone jack to make the connection respond. They were ranked to be one of the top best for running, but I have to disagree.
customer_reviews.author: benjamin milgram

customer_reviews.title: Input plug defective
customer_reviews.text: When properly plugged into device, headphones do produce good quality sound. The problem however is the input plug requires manipulation, turning etc., to get that good connection. I tried it on several devices including iPad, and saw the same consistent problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tragas

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: i love these. they work well. i hope they last longer than others i have purchased. why must i post so many words on these reviews?
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Broke after month and a half of use
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound, ok quality, but the right earbud cut out after 45 days of use. Don't bother purchasing this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mighty BakuDan

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them for a few weeks now. They are good headphones, especially for the price. Nothing fancy about them really, but they cancel out noise very well and have great sound quality for earbuds under $50.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality on these earphones are great for their price. The only complaint I would have was that mine broke after a few days but after contacting the company I was given a replacement not long after. Would highly recommend these earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use on long run. Overall, they get the job done. I can hear the cords rubbing against my shirt from time to time and the earbuds aren't sweat proof, but for the price, they're great!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: rha highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: just got these ma 150's. I am impressed with the sound. not bad at all for the price. they have good bass response. I use them with a sansa player. mine were $12.95. they blow a lot of $12 buds away. you can get some $8 ones and throw money away or add just a few bucks and get something descent. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Cray ze

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: They broke in left ear after like a week not worth it they were good at first then broke I was disapointed read all the good reviews and ignored the bad ones the bad ones are right
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 2 pairs of these already and I cannot recommend them enough. They sound great and are extremely good for noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Lee Cater

customer_reviews.title: Best at the price point
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs really get the job done. Drowns out my very loud office. Standard length. Comfortable for long periods of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Best Bass for the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sounding in-ear headphones I've ever been lucky enough to purchase. My hat goes off to RHA!
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product for the price. The bass is much better than other cheap ones. I use my finger to touch it to know which is the right or left.
customer_reviews.author: Zhichao Gao

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds for $20
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for a $20 set of earbuds. I wish there were more features (in line controls for example), but again, these are only $20.
customer_reviews.author: George Ganzer

customer_reviews.title: Best active headphone period
customer_reviews.text: I go through headphones every 3-6 months and this is the best pair I've ever purchased. The stay in place well, great sound and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Hutton Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for your average listener. Fantastic price point and a real quality product. I would recommend to anyone! Im actually about to buy another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: 1 month then broke
customer_reviews.text: As others have experienced these headphones broke after 1 month. One of the ear buds stopped producing sound. Bad quality product - stay away. Happened 2 days after return period. What a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Good For A Short TIme
customer_reviews.text: I loved these at first, they fit perfectly and did not fall out while I was running. However, after only a few times wearing them, the plug that goes into my phone became shotty and the music wouldnt feed thruogh unless I held the base of the plug on the earphones a certain way. I was soooooooooo dissapointed because randomly when I would run, the music would cut off. I wouldnt reccomend buying earphones that have a right angle plug, stick with a plug that goes straight in.
customer_reviews.author: Anjeli Gupta

customer_reviews.title: great earphones
customer_reviews.text: I love the ear buds, they stay in well, sound is great but the cord is very thin and tangles easily. Still a bargain at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline F Calkins

customer_reviews.title: not a durable product
customer_reviews.text: It didnt live up to the one year warranty. It just lasted 2 months not 1 year. Why they lying
customer_reviews.author: florentino

customer_reviews.title: one ear bud stopped working after 2 months of use !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT RECOMMEND - WASTE OF 20 DOLLARS! 1 EAR BUD STOPPED WORKING AFTER 60 DAYS! don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: felicialynne

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the dollars.
customer_reviews.text: So so ear phones for the money I guess you don't expect more. They fit fine, I am not overly excited about the quality of sound. For the money I guess so do as a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Sound is okay
customer_reviews.text: But the fit is terrible. Not a big fan of these at all even for the low price. I'd pass.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin R Wolf

customer_reviews.title: must be tall
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good enough, but unless you are 6'4" or taller, the cord is too long and always catching on corners
customer_reviews.author: Norman M. Palgon

customer_reviews.title: Broken: No sound from either ear piece after 1mo use.
customer_reviews.text: After using the earphones during my running workouts for less than one month, they are broken. Neither ear-piece is producing sound now. I do not think these are made to handle sweat/water.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: "You get what you paid for" definitely applies here. Buy them only if your interested in super flat, tinny music.
customer_reviews.author: hugh sheean

customer_reviews.title: good until stopped working after a month of regular useage
customer_reviews.text: after about of 1 month using, one of the earbuds stopped working, how do i get a replacement? help me rha...!
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: crappy headphones in which i would not recommend to anyone. I read an article about them is why i purchsed
customer_reviews.author: joshuah embrey

customer_reviews.title: Basic Earphone
customer_reviews.text: I bought the RHA MA150 Earphones based on an article in the Chicago Tribune. I found them to be no better than the earphones that same with my iPod. I will keep them as a spare, but definitely don't consider them an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak Midtones and Bass
customer_reviews.text: Sound is lacking in midtones and weak in bass. Fiddling with my iPod Nano's EQ helps a bit, but overall disapponting. It may partly be a fit problem - even largest earbud adaptors rattle around in my ear a bit more than I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: ank

customer_reviews.title: About as good as any other cheap earphones and I've tried a ...
customer_reviews.text: About as good as any other cheap earphones and I've tried a lot. Quality is good, still holding up after 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jet98765

product_meta.title: RHA MA150 Noise Isolating In-Ear Headphone - 12 Month Warranty
product_meta.description:
RHA MA150 Noise Isolating In-Ear Earphones Featuring RHA's unique aero phonic design and acclaimed sound signature, the MA150 combines outstanding audio, minimalist design and affordability in a lightweight in-ear headphone. Using a design inspired by a trumpet's bell which channels sound naturally from the high-performance dynamic driver units into the ear, the MA150 is capable of delivering a wide frequency range including powerful bass, dynamic mid tones and clear treble for authentic sound reproduction. A choice of soft silicone tips in three sizes (S/M/L) are provided to ensure optimum comfort, secure fit and effective noise isolation, ensuring a powerful personal sound experience in any environment. The lightweight MA150 features an understated design: using an ABS casing and a matte-black, 1.2m Y-shaped rubber cable with anti-tangle slider; finished with a 45 degree gold plated 3.5mm connector. -High performance 10mm driver for full and accurate sound reproduction -Three sets of soft, silicone tips for optimum comfort and noise isolation -45 degree angled, gold plated, 3.5mm connector -1.2m Y-shaped symmetrical cable with anti-tangle slider -12 month warranty Specifications Drivers - 10mm Mylar Frequency range - 16-22,000Hz Impedance - 16ohms Rated/max power - 3010mW Sensitivity - 103dB Cable - 1.2m matte-black, rubber, symmetrical Connections - 3.5mm, 45 degree angled, Gold Plated The RHA MA150 will be shipped in RHA's unique Eco Pack packaging, produced entirely from recyclable materials for environmentally friendly disposal. Editor's Choice PCMag Looking for an inexpensive pair of earphones to power your daily commute? RHA has you covered'

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Cutaway diagram  RHA MA150 — NOISE ISOLATING IN-EAR HEADPHONE 
 Featuring RHA's unique aerophonic design and acclaimed sound signature, the MA150 combines outstanding audio, minimalist design and affordability in a lightweight in-ear headphone. 

 The lightweight MA150 features an understated design: using an ABS casing and a matte-black, 1.2m Y-shaped rubber cable with anti-tangle slider; finished with a 45 degree gold plated 3.5mm connector. 

 *  High performance dynamic driver for full and accurate sound reproduction 
 *  Three sets of soft, silicone tips for optimum comfort and noise isolation 
 *  45 degree angled, gold plated, 3.5mm connector 
 *  1.2m Y-shaped cable with anti-tangle slider 

MA150 in-ear headphone  UNIQUE AEROPHONIC SHAPE 
 Using a design inspired by a trumpet's bell which channels sound naturally from the high-performance driver units into the ear, the MA150 is capable of delivering a wide frequency range including powerful bass, dynamic mid tones and clear treble for authentic sound reproduction. 

 NOISE ISOLATING 
 A choice of soft silicone tips in three sizes (S/M/L) is provided to ensure optimum comfort, secure fit and effective noise isolation, ensuring a powerful personal sound experience in any environment. 

 12 MONTH WARRANTY 
 The MA150 is covered by a comprehensive 12 month manufacturer's warranty. 

 
 DESIGNED IN THE UK 
 RHA creates unique, high specification audio products, designed and engineered at their research and development centre in Glasgow, UK. 

 Every product has been engineered to deliver professional grade, cutting edge sound. Each feature, detail and component is the result of extensive research and an uncompromising commitment to innovation and quality. 

 ECO PACKAGING 
 The RHA MA150 will be shipped in RHA's unique Eco Pack packaging, making it entirely recyclable.
